lesson19_20.task6

Class Matrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • lesson19_20.task6.Matrix

  • public class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object
    The Matrix class represents a two dimensional m-by-n array of expressions, arranged in rows and columns. Each expression is a double - number. Class allow to perform such basic operations as addition, subtraction, multiplication Matrix by Matrix, or number and etc.
    Version:
    1.0 on 01.07.2017
    Author:
    Petrykin Sergey

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int columnsQuantity
      The value is used for number of columns storage.
      private double[][] m
      The value is used for matrix elements storage.
      private int rowsQuantity
      The value is used for number of rows storage.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Matrix()
      Initializes a newly created Matrix object with 0-dimension.
      Matrix(double[][] matrix)
      Initializes a newly created Matrix object from double[][] object.
      Matrix(int rowsQuantity, int columnsQuantity)
      Initializes a newly created Matrix object so that it represents a 2-dimensional array with rowsQuantity-by-columnsQuantity size with zero-elements.
      Matrix(Matrix a)
      Initializes a newly created Matrix object so that is copy of input Matrix object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Matrix add(Matrix a)
      Add two Matrix objects that have equal dimensions.
      Matrix add(java.lang.Number a)
      Add number a to each elements of initial matrix.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
      Indicates whether some other Matrix object is "equal to" this one.
      void fillRandom()
      Fill each elements of Matrix object as double random value from 0.0 to 1.0.
      void fillUnit()
      Fill elements of Matrix object so that element with equal row- and column- indexes setup with 1.0, other elements setup with 0.0.
      int getColumnsQuantity()
      Return number of Matrix columns.
      double getDeterminant()
      Return determinant of initial matrix.
      double getElement(int row, int column)
      Return Matrix element double value at row-column position.
      private Matrix getMinor(int rm, int cm)
      Return a square matrix so that contains all rows and columns of initial matrix exclude rm-row and cm-column.
      int getRowsQuantity()
      Return number of Matrix rows.
      int hashCode()
      Returns a hash code value for the object.
      Matrix multiply(double a)
      Multiply each elements of initial matrix by number a.
      Matrix multiply(Matrix a)
      Multiply two Matrix objects so that rows number of argument matrix must be equal columns number of initial matrix.
      void print(java.lang.String matrixName)
      Print Matrix object representation to console with title.
      void setElement(int row, int column, double value)
      Setup Matrix element at row-column position by double value.
      Matrix subtract(Matrix a)
      Subtract two Matrix objects that have equal dimensions.
      Matrix subtract(java.lang.Number a)
      Subtract number a from each elements of initial matrix.
      void toFile(java.io.FileWriter fw, java.lang.String matrixName)
      Output Matrix object representation to file.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the Matrix object.
      Matrix transpose()
      Return transposed matrix with respect to initial matrix.

      • add

        public Matrix add(Matrix a)
        Add two Matrix objects that have equal dimensions.
        Parameters:
        a - matrix must be added to initial matrix
        Returns:
        sum of two matrices, if they have equal dimensions or matrix with 0-dimension if matrices have non-equal dimensions
